description: This course is an introduction to the basic tools and resources available to scholars for the study of the premodern Islamic Middle East, as well as to current discussions and controversies over methodological questions. Through the pursuit of specific projects, students will learn to use bibliographies, geographical and biographical reference works, fundamental lexicographical and philological texts, epigraphical and numismatic resources, manuscript catalogs, and other essential components of the Islamicist's workshop. They will also be given an overview of current trends in the field, with particular emphasis on the flashpoints.
name: METHODS MEDIEVAL ISLAM: Methods in Medieval Islamic Studies
